pipenostics 0.1.0
  • Reference

ASME B31G. A-factor

b31gafr.Rd

Calculate intermediate factor related to the geometry of the corroded zone.

b31gafr(d, wth, l)

Arguments

d

nominal outside diameter of the pipe, [inch]. Type: [double].
wth

nominal wall thickness of the pipe, [inch]. Type: [double].
l

measured maximum longitudial length of the corroded area, [inch]. Type: [double].

Value

Intermediate factor related to the geometry of the corroded area, []. Type: [double].

References

ASME B31G-1991. Manual for determining the remaining strength of corroded pipelines. A supplement to ASTME B31 code for pressure piping.

See also

Other ASME B31G functions: b31crvl(), b31gacd(), b31gacl(), b31gdep(), b31gmodpf(), b31gops(), b31gpf(), b31gsap()

Examples

 b31gafr(30, .438, 7.5)

#> [1] 1.847
 # [1] 1.847  # A-factor is less than 5, so the corrosion is not critical

 ## unit test:
 data(b31gdata)
 with(b31gdata, all.equal(b31gafr(d, wth, l), A))

#> [1] TRUE
